transcript.title: TRANSCRIPT OF THE PRIME MINISTER THE HON JOHN HOWARD MP DOORSTOP INTERVIEW - LIBERAL PARTY FEDERAL SECRETARIAT CANBERRA
transcript.content:
E&OE...........................................

JRNLST:

You've offered to fund a High Court challenge against the Wik

plan. Will this stop the critics, do you think?

PRIME MINISTER:

Well this is the circuit breaker that can see this matter resolved

in an honourable way.

What we're saying is, let the court decide. The Senate should

pass the bill. If it is challenged, as I am sure it will be, then

the Government will fund that challenge and moreover, we will approach

the High Court in the normal way and ask the Court to expedite its

hearing.

Now this is the honourable way out and I do hope earnestly that Mr

Beazley seizes the moment and says yes, this is a way in which the

court can resolve the matter because much of the Labor Party's

criticism of our legislation has been on the basis that it might be

unconstitutional and we are prepared of course to allow that to be

determined and we will ask that it be determined as quickly as possible.

The Australian people want this matter resolved. This is the honourable

way of resolving it. I now say to Mr Beazley, you should seize this

opportunity to have this matter honourably resolved.

Thank you.

ENDS
